data.title: Zurich Climate Zurich Temperatures Zurich, Switzerland Weather Averages
data.text:
⛺ Zurich has a marine west coast climate that is mild with no dry season, warm summers. Heavy precipitation occurs during mild winters which are dominated by mid-latitude cyclones. Seasonality is moderate (Köppen-Geiger classification: Cfb).

⛳ Zurich is situated in or near the cool temperate wet forest biome.

🌡️ The annual mean temperature is 8.5 degrees Celsius (47.3 degrees Fahrenheit). See the temperatures page for a monthly breakdown and the fixed scale graph.

🐬 Average monthly temperatures vary by 18.2 °C (32.8°F). This indicates that the continentality type is oceanic, subtype semicontinental.

☔ Total annual precipitation averages 1101 mm (43.3 inches) which is equivalent to 1101 Litres/m² (27 Gallons/ft²).

Embed this graph on your webpage!

Simply paste the following HTML code into your webpage. Please include a link back to this website. There is one in the following code already. Edit the width attribute to change the size of the graph if needed:

In the winter time records indicate temperatures by day reach 2.9°C (37.3°F) on average falling to -2°C (28.5°F) overnight.

In spring time temperatures climb reaching 12.4°C (54.3°F) generally in the afternoon with overnight lows of 4°C (39.2°F).

During summer average high temperatures are 21.2°C (70.2°F) and average low temperatures are 11.8°C (53.2°F).

Come autumn/ fall temperatures decrease achieving average highs of 12.5°C (54.4°F) during the day and lows of 5.8°C (42.4°F) generally shortly after sunrise.

✨ The longest day of the year is 15:44 long on the 22 of June and the shortest day is 8:15 long on the 21 of December.

🌞 On average there are 1693 hours of sunshine per year. Visit the sunshine and daylight section to check monthly details including how high in the sky the sun reaches each month.

🐇Were you to burrow down through the centre of the Earth from Zurich you would pop up nearest to the climate station at Te Wharau, Glenburn, New Zealand (Warm temperate thorn steppe biome).

🌍Zurich, Switzerland is at 47°22'N, 8°33'E, 558 m (1829 ft). Check the location on the map.
